tool_description: Generate and validate time-based one-time passwords (TOTP) for your second factor authentication (2FA) scenario using Microsoft Authenticator app
name: Microsoft Authenticator
title: Microsoft Authenticator

api_list.name: enroll
api_list.description: Step 2. Generate QR code and enroll using Google Authenticator app

utterances.utterance: Enroll my account with the secret code IH225HMVWDS3XJVY.
Generate a QR code for the secret code IH225HMVWDS3XJVY for my account at HomeCorp.
Use the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY to enroll my account User1.
I need to enroll using the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY for my company account.
Please generate a QR code with the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY for my HomeCorp account.
Enroll my User1 account using the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY.
I want to use the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY to enroll my account with HomeCorp.
Generate a QR code for my account using the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY.
Use the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY to enroll my account at HomeCorp.
Enroll my account with the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY and issuer HomeCorp.

api_list.name: new_v2
api_list.description:
Step 1. Generate new secret 

nb! This is the absolutely the same as the /new/, the only difference is that here we omit the return message "Your new secret: ", which makes it a little easier to parse the results
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://microsoft-authenticator.p.rapidapi.com/new_v2/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "microsoft-authenticator.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://microsoft-authenticator.p.rapidapi.com/new_v2/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "microsoft-authenticator.p.rapidapi.com"

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: new

api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://microsoft-authenticator.p.rapidapi.com/new/"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "microsoft-authenticator.p.rapidapi.com"

print(response.json())

api_list.name: validate

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Temporary code generated by Microsoft Authenticator app

utterances.utterance: Can you validate the TOTP using the secret code IH225HMVWDS3XJVY and the temporary code 425079?
Please check if the code 425079 is valid with the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY.
I need to verify the TOTP with secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY and code 425079.
Is the temporary code 425079 correct for the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY?
Validate the one-time password using secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY and code 425079.
Can you confirm the TOTP with secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY and code 425079?
Check the validity of the code 425079 for the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY.
I want to validate the TOTP using the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY and the code 425079.
Please verify if the code 425079 matches the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY.
Can you authenticate the TOTP with the secret IH225HMVWDS3XJVY and the code 425079?
